line.en: The next day, the typhoon had passed and a blue\nsky spread over Kazegaura.
'So that's why we ask for your favorable\nconsideration, president!'
'Please consider it!'
'Please!'
Standing behind Kotori, we bow our heads.
This is a fourth-year classroom.
Yesterday, we were ordered to go to the student\ncouncil room. So, we decided to take the\ninitiative and go to Akari's classroom.
We state the matter frankly...
...we are making an application for the revival\nof the Soaring Club.
It was a negotiation to restore the Soaring Club,\nwhich lost its status last year.
'That matter has already been rejected, Kotori.'
'But that was under the previous student council,\nright?'
'We thought that you might have different ideas.'
The title of leader of the Soaring Society isn't\njust a decoration.
For a year, Kotori has been negotiating with the\nstudent council for the revival of the Soaring\nClub.
However, the previous student council president\nhad said that 'I don't think that Tobioka-sensei\nwould allow it...
That was a typical example of someone who is\nafraid to rock the boat.
The previous student council was dissolved, and\nin the election held a few days ago, Akari was\nchosen as the new student council president.
In her case, she might actually listen to what we\nhave to say, so Kotori finally had grounds for\nnegotiation.
Akari was deep in thought as she stared at the\napplication petition for the revival of the club.
We watched over her with tense expressions.
If it isn't officially recognized as a club,\nthere are a few circumstances that could spell\ntrouble for us.
First, is the issue of the ownership of the\nglider.
That is property of the Soaring Club, so if it\nbecomes a club again, it should be officially\nrecognized as being under our ownership.
It was built using club funds, which is why it\nwas taken away by the school, along with the\nclub's status.
In actuality, over half the funds for the\nconstruction were paid by Amane herself.
There was also the problem of the club's funds.
Currently, we are facing a serious shortage of\nfunds.

The parts and materials come from Ageha and
Kotori helping out at An-chan's place but the
transport costs for Ageha and I to go to the
airfield, and the cost of the flight training is
no joke.
Our intention is to use the funds to help cover\nthese costs, even if only by a little.
Another thing; the fact that we can't use the\nschool facilities.
For the manufacturing of the parts, even if we\nwant to use the school's equipment, they won't\ngive us permission.
Everyone just uses it freely, but with Tobioka\nkeeping an eye on us, being found out could cause\nproblems.
Lastly, we don't have anywhere to conduct our\nactivities.
As a result, we had to occupy the room used by\nthe Kazato sisters.
We can't continue to use the dormitory as our\nbase of operations.
'Please, student council president! You know that\nwe were serious about carrying out our club's\nactivities!'
'That's right! To Keifuu Academy, there's no\nother club which has such fitting club\nactivities, don't you think?'
Everyone was desperately pleading with her,\nbut...
'...Before that...'
Glare... Akari stared at us with a scary\nexpression on her face.
'There's something I want to ask you all.'
'It's about the glider that disappeared from the\nstore room.'
Her voice dropped down a tone!
That alone was enough to make us cower in fear.
'Whatever could you mean...?'
Even if we're totally busted, we have no choice\nbut to play dumb.
Akari is usually a fair person, but she wouldn't\nbe that flexible.
If it was clear that we had taken it away, she\nwould definitely have to take action.
'Someone sneaked into the store room, and stole\nthe glider that was being kept there.'
'I wonder who would carry away such an enormous\nthing as that?'
The way she said it made it sound like she was\nimplying 'I know it was you'.
She's completely right though.
The thing with the glider was a huge\nmiscalculation on our part.
We knew that it would be a big disadvantage when\nit came to applyingfor the restoration of the\nclub, but it couldn't be avoided.
Knowing that this would happen, we came to her\nfirst to negotiate.
'C-... Could it be some kind of geek? Like an\nairplane geek? Maybe they really wanted it,\nregardless of the circumstances!'
As I desperately try to give a suitable answer,\nAkari looks towards me.
'...You're saying it wasn't you?'
'It... it wasn't... no way.'
I answer while choking on my words.
My heart feels heavy as Akari's eyes, full of\nrighteousness, shoot a gaze right through me.

'Very well. However, if it is made clear that you
have been committing any form of misconduct,
there's no way that I can defend you, so be
warned.'
Without thinking, I answered honestly, and Ageha\ngave me a poke in the ribs.
That was like I was saying 'Actually, we stole\nit'.
'Even so, it was arranged that it would be\ndonated to the museum next week. This seems like\nvery good timing, doesn't it...?'
said Akari, as she caught a glimpse of our\nexpressions.
It seems that she'd like to know about that.
About who leaked the information to us.
'Akari!'
At that moment, Masatsugu appeared, calling out\nin a frivolous voice.
'What time does today's student council meeting\nstart?'
'4 PM, Masatsugu.'
'So, you're free until then? You wanna go\nsomewhere for a cup of tea... Hmm? What're you\nguys doin 'here?'
That bonehead Masatsugu, he's only just realized\nwe're here.
'What're you doing?'
'We came to apply for the restoration of the\nclub...'
'So you can just get the hell outta here.'
'Hmph! What's with that attitude? I'm a member of\nthe student council!'
Masatsugu sticks his chest out in a patronizing\nkind of way.
Oh yeah, that's right, he joined the student\ncouncil this year as its secretary.
In response to Masatsugu, Akari...
...glared at him.
'What's the problem, Akari?'
'We're having an important conversation right\nnow. It's about the glider being stolen.'
'Ah, ah... ah...'
'I've thought it was strange from the very\nbeginning. That it would be stolen just before it\nwas about to be donated to the museum.'
'If we assume that the culprit was a regular\nstudent, how would they have gotten that\ninformation...?'
'Erm... Well... Just how did they do that? I'm\nnot so clever, so I don't really understand\nit...'
Ageha and I look at each other.
Isn't there a better way we can try to trick her?
Akari seemed convinced by this poor attempt at\ndeceiving her, and didn't pursue it any further.
For the time being, it's good that she didn't\nfind the perpetrator who leaked the information.
By the way, this is kind of besides the point,\nbut it looks like Masatsugu has broken up with\nhis girlfriend, who he was in a band with.
According to him, the reason was because of\nmusical differences.
According to Ageha, he got dumped.
After that, he met the girl he was destined to be\nwith.
An older girl called Akari Kumoi.
Then, in order to chase after her, he joined the\nstudent council.
That's the end of that little side-story.
'As for the club having lost its status, it's as\nwe discussed before.'
'I feel sympathetic to your cause, but there's\nnothing I can do about it.'

Right after Amane left, it was decided in a staff
meeting that the club would have its status
repealed without any notification, and then the
garage was forcibly taken from us and demolished.
This was all under the instruction of Tobioka.
Some of the students were against it but Tobioka\nwent ahead and forced it to be demolished.
The reason was... that this had been promised\nfrom the beginning.
'Actually, I don't approve of it either.'
'The condition for the club losing its status was\nsimply that there were no other members besides\nMochizuki-senpai...'
'Whereas in actual fact, all of you guys were\nthere too.'
'In spite of that, it was decided that the club's\nstatus would be repealed just for the convenience\nof the teaching staff...'
'If I had been student council president at that\ntime, I would have put up more of a fight...'
She spoke with her fists clenched and a furrowed\nbrow, and she looked genuinely frustrated.
She won't forgive those who selfishly ignore the\nrules, even if they are teachers!
So that's what happened.

She's the one who, when all is said and done, was
working hard to help the Soaring Club to survive
by putting pressure on Amane, who had been
continuing with the club all by herself,
at the time when the club was in danger of being\nshut down.
'So, please allow our revival!'
'Yes, president! The decision to repeal its\nstatus should never have been made!'
This was our big chance to make ourselves heard,\nbut Akari shook her head.
'Why not?'
'Because it doesn't fulfill the conditions of\nbeing a club.'
'First, you don't have enough members.'
Now, there are only three members. To be a club,\nyou need at least four members.
'Next is the validity of the club's activities...\nWell, there are no problems there.'
This is about whether or not the activities are\nsuitable for a student club. There's no problem\nas far as that goes.
'There is a lack of qualified personnel. That is\na serious problem.'
'If you're talking about a pilot's license, Aoi's\ngot one!'
'That's not enough, though, is it?'
As well as the pilot, you also need\nqualifications for the equipment.
Things like gliders cannot be administered\nwithout qualified personnel.
Before, Amane had all of the necessary\nqualifications, so it wasn't a problem.
'Finally, there's the absence of an advisor.'
Yamanobe-sensei, who had until last year been the\nadvisor, withdrew when the Soaring Club lost its\nstatus.
He was under close scrutiny from Tobioka, and had\nto deal with a 'super problem child' like Amane\nMochizuki,
so it's no wonder a third of his hair had gone\nwhite, despite still being quite young.
'If you can't solve all of the aforementioned\nproblems, there's no way I can accept your\napplication.'
'You're so stingy!'
'Stingy...? (Angry)'
'...Even if the student council allows it,\nTobioka-sensei wouldn't allow it, would he?'

The way she spoke was quite gentle but what she
really meant was 'There's no way Tobioka will let
this slide if you can't fulfill the minimum
conditions'.
'In other words, you're saying it's not entirely\nimpossible?'
Akari nods.
'If you can meet these conditions, we in the\nstudent council will negotiate with the teaching\nstaff.'
'With a look on her face that said 'This is what\nbeing fair is all about', Akari reassured us.
'Thank you very much, president!'
We bow, as we make our way out of the fourth-year\nclassroom.
'Make sure that the glider isn't found, OK?'
'OK!'
'Haha, you're so honest.'
As I empathically reply, Akari treated it as a\njoke and paid no attention.
'I didn't think that you guys would actually go\nahead and steal it!'
As we step out into the hallway, Masatsugu came\nstraight over to protest.
'So what did you think we were gonna do?'
'Well...'
The one who gave us the news that the glider\nwould be donated to the museum, was none other\nthan this guy.
It seems he found out because it came up in the\nstudent council agenda.
'We didn't steal it, we took it back. It belongs\nto us, after all.'
'Yeah but, there must've been a better way than\nthis...'
'What do you mean? In the past, we used to play\nway more pranks than this with An-chan, didn't\nwe?'
Ageha says 'Yup!' as she nods.
'We did, didn't we? Then we got in big trouble.'
'I... I'm not like you guys, I'm an honest kind\nof guy!'
'How much hard work did I... I mean, we, put into\nmaking that thing?'
'When you think about that, what you did was no\nbig deal.'
'...That's what I thought, which is why I told\nyou.'
'Just don't get reckless.'
'Well then, that's all for homeroom class. Can\nthe person on day duty please come forward?'
'Stand up. Stand to attention, and bow!'
'Hahaha! Asa!'
'You're not getting away from me today! You're\ngoing to come and take a look at our Card Club!'
'Umm, that's kind of... I mean...'
'What's all this about? You still haven't joined\nany clubs, have you, Asa?'
'Y...yes, that's true.'
'C'mon! Please! Just come and take a look! There\nare no new members at all, and the seniors are\nreally worried about it! I'm lonely too!'
'Including me, there are only two first years,\nand the other one's a boy. I'm really lonely.\nPlease! C'mon!'
'S-...Since you put it like that... I might just\ngo and take a look...'
'See, I knew you'd help me out! There aren't any\nother clubs you want to join, are there? I'll\ntreat you to some Mabo Tofu!'
'I'll also buy you some Tan Tan noodles! I've\nfound a Chinese restaurant that does super-spicy\nfood!'
'T...Tan Tan noodles... (drools)'
'Ha ha ha, I know how much you love spicy food.\nThis was a good way to tempt you.'
'(Gulp!)'
'Sis.'
'Oh, Yoru. Is your homeroom class finished too?'
'Yeah, what's up?'
'Well, I've been invited by a girl in my class to\njoin her club.'
'Oh, are you Asa's twin sister? Maybe you'd be\ninterested too. Card games might seem a little\nboring but the games can get quite heated...'
'I'll pass. I'm not really interested in card\ngames.'
'Ah... Yoru, wait!'
'Wait, Yoru. That wasn't very nice, just now!'
'What? I'm not really into cards. You're the\nsame, right?'
'Yes, but...'
'Sis, you're not very good at turning people\ndown. One day, someone will take advantage of\nyou, and you'll suffer because of it.'
'I-...I'm OK! I'm smart enough to realize that!'
'So now you're calling yourself smart, huh?'
'A-...Also, when someone comes to talk to me, I\ncan't just give some kind of offhand response.'
'Sheesh. You really are kind, aren't you? If\nthat's the case, you should've joined the Card\nClub.'
'B-...But, that's...'
'That's what?'
'...Hey, Yoru. Where do the Soaring Society carry\nout their activities?'
'Why are you talking about that all of a sudden?'
'Well, I just...'
'...Sis, could it be...?'
'Umm, well...'
'You should give up on that. The Soaring Society\ndoesn't count as club activities.'
'That's why no one joins, or goes anywhere near\nthem. If you join a club with guys like that,\nyou'll...'
'You know a lot about it, Yoru.'
'...Yeah, I guess so.'
'So you know where they go about their activities\ntoo?'
'I don't know that. Even though I'm trying to\nstop you, you're going to do it anyway, aren't\nyou, sis?'
'...Sheesh.'
'But, it's really unusual for you to get so fired\nup about something. Is that why you're getting\nangry about it?'
'Huh?'
'Those meanies, trying to take away my beloved\nsister, the light of my life. I'll never forgive\nthem...'
'Yoru...?'
'Even though I try so hard, it doesn't have any\neffect on you! Why are you so cheerful all of a\nsudden?'
'Huh? What?'
'Recently, you've been in a really vague state of\nmind. So, why? Why?'
'W...Why, you say...?'

'Since coming to the dormitory, you've had a fire
in your eyes, you've been more cheerful, so I'm
happy about it, but as well as that, I'm really
frustrated...!'
'Y...Yoru? ... Ah!'
'Hmm?'
'We didn't steal it, we took it back. It belongs\nto us, after all.'
'Yeah but, there must've been a better way than\nthis...'
'What do you mean? In the past, we used to play\nway more pranks than this with An-chan, didn't\nwe?'
'We did, didn't we? Then we got in big trouble.'
'I... I'm not like you guys, I'm an honest kind\nof guy!'
'Aren't you going to go and talk to them?'
'No, it looks like they're enjoying themselves.'
'I don't understand why you won't talk to them\nbecause they're enjoying themselves...'
'If I butt in, it'll just be an inconvenience to\nthem. I'll just mess up their sense of\ncommunity...'
'Sis, it's really annoying how you have these\nhalf-hearted reservations about things.'
'Urk!'
'If that's the case, what are you going to do\nabout the Soaring Society...?'
'Gulp! B...But...!'

'You should go and talk to them if that's what
you want to do. Also, you could ask them about
where they do their activities while you're
there.'
'Y...Yes, you're right, but...'

'Geez, you really do always put other people
first, sis. You're different to someone
self-centered like me, to the point where it's
kind of worrying.'
'Well, I think that's one of your good points,\nthough.'
'It's... not that I put others first. I can be\nself-centered too! I'm the one who suddenly said\nthat I wanted to move out!'
'...Then I got you involved in all of this.'
'If you're talking about me, I chose to come with\nyou. ... Because I worry about you.'
'See? I really am causing problems for you!'

'So, if you're planning on causing problems for
people, why don't you ask Grandpa to buy you a
glider? He might buy you something like that, you
know?'
'Uh... That's not it. I don't want to buy one.\nThat's not what I want, I want to build one by\nhand, then fly it!'
'Umm... How should I put this?'
'What?'
'I can't really explain, but...'
'That's' the sort of thing that I want to do.'
'...Hmph.'
'It's your dream, right? That's something that I\ndon't really understand. I just think it's some\nsort of silly game. But...'
'That's just like you.'
'Let's solve them one at a time.'
On the way home, we were discussing the\nconditions that Akari spoke to us about.
'The easiest one to solve is getting enough\nmembers. Ageha, do you have anyone in mind?'
'Hmm... hardly any. Shino and a couple of others\nwere interested. How about you, Aoi?'
'I hardly have any ideas either. There's no one\nwho has actually come forward and said that they\nwant to join.'

The general popularity of the Soaring Club has
risen since Amane's stay as the sole member. The
number of people interested in the club's
activities has increased.

On the other hand, the rumor that if you get
involved, Tobioka-sensei will have his eye on you
is also spreading. So, that deters some people
from easily enjoying.
'Kotori, how about you?'
As Kotori sat there in her wheelchair, she looked\ndown, deep in thought.
Her expression seemed gloomy, somehow.
'What's up, Kotori?'
'...I don't want any new members to join.'
'Hey, what's this all of a sudden?'
'It's just that, whoever that person is, they\ndon't know what our feelings are, or what we\nintend to do.'
'About how we are longing for the Morning Glory,\nor about Amane and Isuka...'
'Or about the day we were so close, but couldn't\nquite make it...'
Ageha and I had the same kind of expression as\nKotori.
We had mixed feelings about having new members\njoin.
We're trying to carry out our activities as a\nclub, so I understand this is a contradiction.
It's not easy to make a clear decision.
'Ahh... I wonder what Amane's doing right now?'
'I dunno... Wouldn't she be the same as always?'
Amane is now working at her father's laboratory.
We sometimes text her but the replies either\ndon't come, or if they do, they come much later.
It's obvious that's she's not much of a writer,\nand it's likely that she doesn't even realize\nwhen a text has been sent to her.
Sometimes she replies to several texts, all at\nthe same time, so the content of the message is\nhard to understand.
She's probably sitting in her seat at the\nlaboratory, but I wonder what she does all day.
'Is she eating properly, I wonder...?'
I feel nostalgic as I recall the way she ate,\nthat totally spoils the effect of her good looks.
We only spent about two months together, but to\nus, that time still feels very special.
'Maybe gliders have become a thing of the past to\nAmane...'
As Kotori mumbles quietly, we all start to feel\nkind of sad.
'When she's concentrating on something, she loses\nsight of everything else around her.'
'Pretty soon, she'll probably make some invention\nthat will amaze the world, don't you think?'
It's possible that Amane's inventions are already\neverywhere, but we just haven't realized.
She's not the sort to boast about her own\nachievements.
Which is why, even if that happened, she wouldn't\ngo as far as to send a text saying 'Isn't that\ngreat?' or something like that.
...We'd like her to send us something though.
'...We have to fly again.'
'Then, we want Amane to see it.'
'Yeah.'
'Right.'
In order to do that, there were many hurdles for\nus to overcome.
One of those was finding new club members.
'We can make these parts using the school's\nequipment. So, if we sneak in at lunchtime...'
'The problem is the main wings...'
'I guess there's no way we can make them unless\nwe have somewhere spacious.'
'It takes time, so it's difficult for us to use\nAn-chan's place.'
'Ugh... If only we had the garage...'
'Hmm? Can we help you?'
We had spread out the designs on the dining hall\ntable. Our faces were huddled together when we\nnoticed Asa watching us from a distance.
...It almost seemed like she was hiding in the\nshadows.
'N-... No, it's nothing...!'
Kotori tilted her head as if to say 'What a\nstrange girl'.
'Oh, are we in the way? Sorry, there are no other\nbig tables.'
Since we lost the garage, Flying Fish Manor has\nbecome the base of operations for the Soaring\nSociety.
We normally use my room, but I've vacated that\nfor now. So, the only other places are here, or\nKotori's room.
We need a table just to lay out the designs, so\nnow we're using the dining hall table.
'I thought that... you were all enjoying\nyourselves.'
'Enjoying ourselves?'
We all looked at each other.
Because we looked like we were all deliberating\nit, Asa felt unnecessarily intimidated.
'Are those... designs?'
'Yeah, for a glider.'
'Are you going to make it? By yourselves?'
'That's right. Not all of it though.'
'Wow... When people become third years, they're\nable to make things like that!'
'As expected of Grandpa's Keifuu Academy...'
'Well... that doesn't really have anything to do\nwith it.'
Until now, we haven't been taught anything in\nclass about making gliders.
'Huh? But you already have a glider...'
'Yeah but something happened.'
'Also, that one's broken!'
Ageha spoke like it was something to laugh about.
In the last flight with Amane, there was damage\nsuch as cracks to the fuselage, and it still\nhasn't been repaired.
'Well, we won't be able to do it for a while. The\nrepairs, or the construction.'
'Why is that...?'
'There's nowhere to do it. For something as huge\nas that, we need an even bigger place to make\nit.'
'A big place, you say...?'
Asa seemed to be mumbling something while deep in\nthought.
'I'm hungry...'
Kanako let out a pathetic whimper as she came\ninto the dining hall.
I look at the clock to see that it's six o'clock.
'It's already this late?'
It's about time to start preparing dinner.
'Shall we call it a day?'
'Yeah, OK then.'
We cheerfully fold up the designs.
'What is it, Asa?'
'Huh? N-... No, it's nothing!'
'OK, see you tomorrow.'
'Yeah.'
Kotori and I see off Ageha, and then go into the\nkitchen.
'Right, let's get dinner ready. What are we\nhaving today?'
'Diablo Chicken, and Rocket Salad -- recipe\ncourtesy of Hibari.'

Yesterday, we made okonomiyaki from leftovers,
which was a little disappointing (having said
that, everyone seemed satisfied), So today, we're
making something more extravagant.
By the way, Diablo Chicken is a spicy dish of\nchicken, fried in peppers and spices -- it's\nunbelievably delicious.
It makes you sweat a lot, so it's the perfect\ndish in the summer.
'OK, I'll make the salad.'
'Sure, I'll leave that to you.'
It's been a year since she started helping with\ndinner. Kotori's gotten used to it too.
'Yay! I love that!'
'It's really tasty, Asa. ... Asa?'
It seems that Asa can't hear Kanako's voice as\nshe stares into the kitchen.
Then, slowly...
'I...I'll help out too!'
she said, as if she were compelled by a sense of\nduty.
'No, it's OK. Right now, we're causing so many\nproblems for you, like not even being able to\ngive you a proper room...'
'That's right. This is my job.'
Asa is looking at Kotori.
'Could it be that you're thinking about a\nwheelchair user like me doing chores?'
'Huh? No, that's not it...'
She fidgets uncomfortably. Seems like Kotori was\nspot on.
'Hahaha! I'd prefer it if you didn't\nunderestimate me. Even though I'm like this, I'm\npretty good, you know.'
Kotori sticks out her modest chest with pride,\nwhile sitting in her wheelchair.
'Don't worry, once the preparations for your room\nhave been finished, we'll give you some chores to\ndo too.'
She seems despondent, somehow.
Does she feel like she's been scolded?
'It's fine, why don't you let her do it?'
'Kanako?'
'It's not like you, Aoi. You might be holding\nback because of the situation with the room. But,\nI don't think it's a good idea in this case.'
'C'mon, Asa, over here.'
Kanako takes Asa by the hand and brings her into\nthe kitchen.
'It's OK. Right, Aoi? What should she do?'
'Umm... OK, could you wash the vegetables?'
To start with, I'll try asking her to do\nsomething that seems easy.
Having said that, since we have to prepare enough\nfor all of the boarders, just washing them is\nquite a big job.
'C'mon!'
Kanako had only brought Asa in here, but it looks\nlike she isn't planning to help.
Asa stands in front of the sink and picks up some\nvegetables.
'So I'm going to wash this, right?'
'There is dirt all over the roots, and so on, so\nwash them carefully.'
'Got it.'
Asa answered with sincerity, then started to wash\nthe vegetables.
...With detergent.
'Stop! Stop...!'
'You can't use detergent!'
'Huh? Huh? But, I'm washing them...'
'Just water is fine!'
'Oh... I see...'
It's been a while since I saw something as stupid\nas washing food with detergent.
'OK, so I wash them with water...?'
Scrub scrub.
Splash.
Scrub scrub scrub scrub.
Splaaaaaash.
Scrub scrub scrub scrub scrub scrub.
'H-...Hold on, Asa.'
'Yes?'
'That's probably enough. If you wash them too\nmuch, they'll lose all the nutrients.'
'Huh!? Really!?'
If we keep on at this pace, we'll never get it\nfinished.
'B-...But, if I only wash them a little, I'm\nscared that there might still be germs on them...\nUmm... Ah...'
'Aaaaaah! That's enough, give it to me!'
'Eek! Huh? Yoru!?'
Yoru appeared from behind and took the vegetables\nfrom Asa's hand.
It seems like she was worried about Asa, so she\nwas watching over her.
'Geez. You're totally missing the point. There's\na lot of them, so if you're just washing them,\nhurry up and get it done!'
Yoru starts washing them in way that looks like\nthe work is flowing smoothly.
In contrast to her appearance and behavior, is\nshe actually good at housework?
She's unexpectedly homely, and might be a good\ngirl after all.
'What should we do after we wash the vegetables?\nIf there's anything else to do, we could do that\nat the same time.'
declared Yoru, who really doesn't seem to have\nany motivation in her voice at all.
'OK, can you cut vegetables?'
'Gimme me a break, of course I can.'
'It would be a big help if you could cut some\nonions, carrots, potatoes, and so on for the\nsoup.'

'Yeah, yeah. I'll say one thing, though. I'm not
doing this to help you guys. I'm just doing this
because I couldn't stand to watch my sister any
longer.'
I stand corrected, she's not a good girl after\nall.
'Here's a peeler.'
'I don't need it. The sprouts are deep, so this\nway is quicker.'
As she said that, Yoru started to peel the skin\nfrom the potatoes with a knife.
She was doing it really nicely, only peeling off\nthe skin and leaving the insides intact.
'H-...Hey, she's pretty good at this!'
'Why do you look so sour about it...?'
After washing the vegetables, without wasting any\ntime at all, she peeled the potatoes and carrots,\nthen started cutting them with the knife.
'What size would you like? Would it be better if\nthey were a bit smaller?'
The potatoes were cut into almost equal\nbite-sized chunks.
'No, that's fine like that.'
'I see. Should I cut the onions thinly?'
'Yeah, lengthways.'
'Sure. I'll say this now, my hourly rate is high,\nyou know.'
Chop chop chop chop, slice slice slice slice.
This seems strange somehow...
'She's really good. I wonder who's better, her or\nAoi?'
'It's annoying, but she's better than me... just\na little though.'
'What is it?'
'Nothing much. Did you make the meals at your\nhouse?'
'Not really. For something like this, you should\nbe able to do it after taking home economics\nclass, right?'
'I can't do it, though...'
'At our house, our parents were often not there.\nShe didn't like the food made by the house staff,\nso Yoru would often make the food.'
'Sis, don't tell them things they don't need to\nknow.'
'Where did you learn to cook? I don't think you'd\nlearn how to do that in home economics class.'
'You can Google it.'
I see.
'So in this age where the Internet is\nflourishing, you can learn to cook without being\ntaught by your parents.'
'Yoru is great, she can remember anything easily\nand is good at everything.'
'That's why I'm so proud of her!'
'Listen sis, I told you not to tell them things\nlike that!'
She's the conceited genius girl.
That day's dinner was really delicious.
A few days have passed since the twins have come\nto Flying Fish Manor.
We searched in several places for somewhere we\ncould move the glider, but we couldn't find\nanywhere.
If we want to rent storage space, it costs a lot\nof money for somewhere that big. There's no way\nwe have that kind of money.
An-chan might be able to find us a place, but\nwhen we thought about the circumstances of the\nglider, we really couldn't get him involved.
Our last resort was...
...to put it in the garden.
We could carry the glider into the garden, and\ncover it with a sheet.
'Overlap it so that the rainwater doesn't get\nin!'
'Kotori, pull that part!'
'Hey, it's not long enough!'
The boarders came to watch us at work.
'Is it alright to leave it somewhere like that?'
'I dunno... I don't think it's very good,\nthough.'
But we can't help it because there's nowhere else\nto put it.
'How long were they planning on making us use\nthis room, I wonder?'
'I don't mind this room, though, you know?'
'The color of the walls, the bay windows and so\non, are quite stylish.'
'Sheesh. Sis, have you forgotten? That this is a\nboy's room?'
'Ohh... that's true. But, Aoi likes to keep\nthings tidy, and is a good person.'
'I don't think that's got anything to do with\nit.'
'Yesterday, some boy's trunks fell down from the\nshelf.'
'I thought that they were your shorts, Yoru! So\nboys... wear those kinds of underpants... That\nwas a surprise.'
'C'mon, let's just give up, and go back home.'
'Or at the very least, let's not live in this\ndilapidated place, and have him find a better\ndormitory.'
'...Could it be, that you are seriously thinking\nabout joining them?'
'To start with, they're thieves!'
'Not all thieves are bad people. Y'know, like\nchivalrous and righteous thieves!'

'They just did that for themselves, though,
didn't they? Saying that it's alright to ignore
the rules to fulfill your dreams just sounds
really selfish to me.'
'I don't think you're in a position to call them\nselfish...'
'...Hmm? Huh? What's that? Everyone's gathering\noutside!'
'Stuff cloth into the Pitot tubes, so that bugs\ndon't get inside.'
'Then, put the cover over the canopy...'
Hearing the noise that we were making, the two\nsisters came outside together.
'What are you doing?'
'We're putting the glider out here. From now on,\nit won't cause you any inconvenience.'
'But a place like this...'
'They said it wouldn't rain for a while. Well, we\nmight be able to do something about it.'
'Kotori, did you say that part's not long\nenough?'
'Seems like it.'
'Will it really be OK, in a place like this?'
'I dunno, it might be.'
'It's made from FRP, so it won't corrode, and\ndoesn't deteriorate easily, but that's not to say\nthat it won't happen at all.'
'That might cause problems with the strength, so\nwhen it's flying it might go CRACK... or\nsomething like that.'
'Waaaah!'
'...It would be good if they had a place where\nthey could put all of it.'
'Yeah, you're right. If there was a place like\nthat...'
'Hey sis, what are you thinking about?'
'That we might be able to put it 'there'...'
'Are you serious...?'
'Hmm? If there's something you want to say, it's\nbetter if you just come out and say it.'
'That's right! There's a good place!'
That voice rang out surprisingly well across the\nair, on this sunny day off.
It was just like it was being read from a\nprepared script, which might be because it was\nstrangely monotone.
Everyone all stared blankly at her at the same\ntime.
Asa became timid.
'See, you were able to say it, so go on.'
Kanako gave Asa a gentle push in the back.
Asa took half a step forward.
'Asa, did you say there's a good place...?'
'Y...Yes! The truth is, I have an idea for a good\nplace!'
'Where? Where?'
Kotori goes for it, without hesitation. At times\nlike this, she's the most earnest.
Asa seemed like she was holding back as she\nglanced at Yoru, then pointed towards the lake.
'Over there.'
'Is it really here?'
The place that Asa had brought us to Windmill\nHill.
The area around here is supposed to be part of\nthe renewable energy research facilities.

This place has been opened up as a walking
course, so that the citizens can enter it freely.
But, there's nowhere that looks like it would be
able to house a glider.
However, Asa climbs over the gently sloping hill.
Behind her, Yoru was sulkily following her.
Asa stopped in front of a large building that had\nbeen built on the edge of Windmill Hill.
'This is it.'
Ageha and I both made a face that seemed to say\n'Here?' at the same time.
We knew about this building.
This had been here since before the windmills\nwhere built.
It looked like a research facility, or a\nstoreroom, and had a somewhat mysterious\nappearance.
We had just decided amongst ourselves that it\was\nthe place for monitoring the water quality of the\nlake.
'In the past, we were going to sneak in here with\nAn-chan.'
'At that time, the door was locked, and we\ncouldn't get inside.'
Asa took a key out of her pocket and opened the\ndoor that had been locked.
'C-...Come on in.'
The ten-year mystery was about to be solved... As\nwe stepped inside, our hearts pounded.
It was a mess inside.

There were several desks, with outdated
computers, documents, cardboard boxes full of
junk. To top things off, there were bottles of
soy sauce and seasonings placed here and there.
From the things there, it seemed like there were\nsigns of activity, but looking at the room as a\nwhole, it seemed like it had been abandoned.
It had an air about it that made it feel like it\nhad been deserted and forgotten about.
'So this is what it's like inside...'
'It has the kind of atmosphere you'd see in a\nzombie movie. Is it still being used?'
'No, there's no one here anymore. It's said that\nGrandpa and the others used it a long time ago.'
'It's not so much an office, but more like a\nresearch center. What were they doing here?'
Ageha goes ahead and starts looking at things in\nthe room.
'I don't know... Grandpa said that it was one of\nhis pastimes when he was young.'
'Why did they leave it here, and not have it\ndemolished?'
'This part of the hill belongs to Grandpa. Now,\nit's just being lent to renewable energy\nresearch.'
'So, he's a big landowner...'
'Ha ha ha, he made quite a lot of money from the\nredevelopment.'
Yoru gave a grin as she spoke.

He's the chairman of the board for Keifuu
Academy, and seems to be a local celebrity. The
reason why he knows my mother might also have
something to do with that.
'We were given the key by our grandpa, and\nsometimes come here.'
'Because we like it here...'
'...You're the one who likes it, sis. I just come\nwith you, that's all.'
Yoru was muttering under her breath.
The reason why she was so sulky must be because\nshe doesn't want anyone else to use it.
We, holding back slightly, took a look around the\nroom.
'It's big but we can't do the work here.'
'But there's no problem with us storing the\nglider here, is there?'
'Oh, no, I don't mean in here.'
Asa totters over to the back of the room.
Passing through the door on the other side...
'Woooooaaaah...'
Kotori was overwhelmed by how spacious it was.
As I looked up at the high ceiling, my mouth was\nagape.
'This isn't so much a garage, it's more like...'
'...A dock.'
Yes, it's a dock.
For building and maintaining ships and airplanes.
That's judging by how vastly spacious it is, and\nthe equipment that's in here.
'Why is something like this. In this kind of\nplace...?'
'Grandpa said that in the past, he and the others\nbuilt airplanes as a hobby.'
'He would always say 'This is where we spent our\nyouth' like it was his favorite phrase.'
If it's Asa's grandfather, then it's possible\nthat this would've been after World War II.
They might have gathered scrap and tinkered\naround with machines.
'How is it...?'
'It's perfect! With this much space, we could\nmake two at the same time!'
'Yeah!'
There's no problem with the space or the\nequipment. Rather, there's actually more than we\nneed.
It's not that far from the runway either. It\nwould be easier to transport it from here than\nfrom the school, which is in the town.
'Let's bring it here right away! Then, we can\nsoon start fixing it.'
'We have to ask An-chan to bring the truck\nround.'
'Wait, wait.'
Their eyes are sparkling like it's already been\ndecided that we'll be using it. So, I stop them\nfor a moment.
Of course, it would be good if we could use it,\nbut for Asa to say that we can use it for nothing\nin return actually makes me kind of worried.
To think that there would be such a great\nfacility here.
'... Is it really OK for us to use it?'
Asa had a meek look on her face as I asked her.
'Th-...There is one condition...!'
Asa spoke nervously as her voice became quite\nhigh-pitched.
So it's really not for nothing after all.
We brace ourselves for what condition might be.
'Please let me join you!'
As Asa shouted out her intentions, her voice\nechoed around the quiet dock!
It echoed for a while before gradually\ndisappearing.
'I don't know anything about gliders, and I can't\ndo anything that would be of use to you.'
'It would be good if I was like Yoru, who can do\nanything...'
'But, But... I... I want to join you in building\nthe glider!'
At the last part, it sounded like she was going\nto cry, as she did her best to speak her mind.
'Kotori.'
Kotori had a serious look on her face as she was\ndeep in thought.
Kotori had said so a few days ago. She'd said\nthat in actual fact, she didn't want any new\nmembers to join.
We felt the same way, but of course Kotori\nunderstood that given the circumstances, there\nwas no way we could not let someone join.
'I guess it's no good after all...'
'Hey, Asa.'
'Why do you want to join us?'
'Are you interested in gliders? Or is it because\nwe seem to be enjoying ourselves?'
'Umm... That's...'
Asa began to stutter as I asked her a slightly\ntricky question.
We needed to recruit new members anyway, and we\nwould be able to use these amazing facilities, so\nit should be OK for us to accept unconditionally.
But I put those thoughts to the back of my mind.
These thoughts that were hard to make sense of,\nfelt like they were stuck in my chest.
'I like this place... I sometimes came here with\nYoru to hang out.'
'Because Grandpa said that he used to build\nplanes here...'
That's what Yoru said before.
... Asa is just interested in things that fly\nthrough the sky.
'... We came here on that day too. Then, a white\naircraft came flying across from the other side\nof the lake.'
'A white aircraft?'
'Until then, I had never even heard of the word\n'glider' before.'
'Could that have been us, by any chance?'
'Which flight would that have been?'
After thinking it over a little, we suddenly\nrealized.
'... Could it be, Was that when we did the first\ntest flight?'
After completing the main wings, we went on our\nfirst test flight. That was also the day that I\npiloted the glider for the first time.
On that day, I flew across the lake to Windmill\nHill.
Then, when we turned around and headed back to\nthe other side of the lake, I noticed that\nsomeone was looking up at us.
That's it, it was two petite girls...
... Just like Kotori, they were girls who like\ngliders.
I remember that was the impression that I had.
'So, Asa and Yoru were the ones here at that\ntime!?'
'... Yes, maybe.'
What is all this? I hadn't even thought about it\nuntil now.
'Then, because I wanted to see the glider again,\nI kept coming here to wait for it.'
'I came here almost every day...'
'After the winch broke, we didn't fly for a\nwhile, did we?'
It appears that during that time, Asa was waiting\nfor us.
'Then a while later... I think it must've been\naround the end of the summer holiday.'
'Something bad happened at home... so, I hid here\nfor a whole night.'
'When I woke up, light was shining through the\nwindow. So I went outside, and there were really\nbeautiful clouds floating in the dawn sky.'
We instinctively reacted with surprise, and\nlooked at each other.
Could it be...?
'Across the purple and pink sky, were clouds that\nlooked like they had been painted with a brush,\nand I looked at them with Yoru.'
'Then, over there...'
Without knowing it, I was shaking.
Ageha held my arm to stop it shaking, Kotori's\nface went red, and had at some point become\nengrossed in Asa's story.
'... The glider was there, flying.'
'You saw it... on that day?'
'At that time, I didn't even know that it was a\nglider, though.'
'I knew that's what it was because Yoru told me.'
'But I looked at it for a long time. For a long\ntime, until the pretty clouds disappeared.'
Asa put her hand on her left arm, and quietly\nclosed her eyes.
It was as if she was reliving the scene of them\ndisappearing, like it was painted on the inside\nof her eyelids.
'Is that the reason?'
'Yes.'
'I still don't know what I can do, or what I want\nto do...'
'But I can't help how I feel!'
'... I can't forget the spectacle I saw that\nday.'
I noticed that Asa's knees were shaking.
It's like she's scared of something.
However, even though she was shaking, she didn't\ngive in.
She summoned her courage, as if there was\nsomething that she desperately wanted to bring\nup.
'Kotori.'
Ageha gave Kotori a gentle pat on the shoulder.
'Yes.'
Kotori nodded.
There was no need to check. We all felt the same\nway.
'You are the only one. The only one who can\nbecome a new member.'
'Welcome to the Soaring Club!'
'As of today, you're one of us!'
As she was suddenly welcomed into the club, tears\nwelled up in Asa's eyes.
Her cheeks had already become as red as apples.
'Is it really OK...?'
'But I don't know anything about gliders...\nThere's nothing I can do that will be of any use\nto you...'
'It's true that to build and fly a glider, you\nneed expert knowledge and techniques.'
'But, not all of the work is like that.'
'We were complete beginners a year ago.'
'All of you...?'
'Isn't that right, Kotori?'
'Yeah, it's not a problem. Just letting us use\nthis place would really help us out of a\ndifficult situation.'
'Also, if you become an accomplice, we don't have\nto worry our secret being found out!'
It felt like Kotori said something both eloquent\nyet crooked, but everyone just completely ignored\nit.
'The most important thing is your feelings of\nwanting to fly through the sky.'
'Wanting to fly through the sky...'
'If that's how you feel, you'll be fine, right?'
'Yeah!'
'That's right!'
'In that case, as of today, do your best, Asa!'
Asa seemed vacant as she wiped away the tears\nthat had accumulated in the corners of her eyes.
'Ok, I'll do my best, everyone!'
As Asa cheerfully lowered her head in a bow, Yoru\nsullenly looked away.
'I'm not joining.'
Looking at her twin sister sulkily making her\nintentions clear, Asa had a troubled expression\nbut a smile then returned to her face.
We took another look at the place that we were\nnow able to use.
Our heads soon started to fill with all the\nthoughts of what we would be able to do here.
'Now we can finally get started.'
'With the preparations for flying.'
Time, which felt like it was going nowhere, began\nto feel like it was accelerating.
'Please, come in, come in.'
'Wooooah... This is our room!?'
Asa's eyes sparkled as she looked at the room\nthat had been tidied up.
'Yoru, Yoru, this is our room!'
'It's so cramped...'
Yoru's eyes seemed to glaze over.
'Even with that great big thing out of the way,\nit's still cramped in here.'
'Somewhere a little on the small side makes it\neasier to relax than somewhere too roomy. See,\nlook, look, Yoru! In the corner!'
As she said that, Asa showed her the pilot's seat\nin the corner of the room.

...However, even though there should be plenty of
room for two people in here, when we consider
that they are the granddaughters of the chairman
of the board of Keifuu Academy,
it seems they might think it's a bit cramped.
'At that moment, I felt the difference in social\nstatus.'
'No, it's OK. I liked your room too, Aoi.'
'It smell's like Papa's room!', is what you\nsaid.'
'Oh... don't tell them that, Yoru!'
There's only two years difference between us.
To someone like me, who other people the same age\nsay is quite mature, it's kind of depressing to\nhear that.
'(I think I'd want to have daughters who are cute\nlike Asa and Yoru.)'
Before that, there would need to be a Mama.
'You can use this room as you please. The rules\nare as I told you before.'
'OK.'
'Yeah yeah.'
'Well then, umm...'
'Hmm? Yes?'
'I'm coming in. Oh, you finally tidied up in\nhere?'
'I live next door, so I've come to share this\nwith you.'
Asa gives a serious bow to Kanako as she comes\nin, carrying chocolate snacks.
'I hope we can be good neighbors, Kanako.'
'Okey dokey! I hope so too!'
After receiving the snacks from Kanako, the\nsisters happily share them between themselves and\nstart eating.
I go over to Kanako and have a quiet word with\nher.
'You seem to pay a lot of attention to these\ntwo.'
During the daytime, it seems she casually gave\nsome advice to Asa, then pushed her forward.
'Hmm? Yeah, you're right, maybe.'
So, which is it?
'If you have any problems, let me know. Us\nneighbors need to look out for each other!'
'OK, thank you very much!'
'Well then, I'll leave the rest to you.'
'Okey dokey.'
I'm relieved that Kanako is taking care of the\ntwo of them.
'Asa, Yoru.'
'Thanks for today. For letting us use that\nplace.'
'N-...No... I'm the one who should thank you. I\nwill do my best!'
'I never said you could use it.'
Yoru turns her back to me, then sits straight\nback down and started stuffing herself with\nchocolate.
Hmm, so she doesn't like me, huh...?
'Let's do our best from tomorrow, OK?'
'OK!'
